title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message:
Hi there, 

Got 820-3437 that try to spin the fan but immediatly shut down. It seems like there is a short on S3 or S0 lines but i cant find it out. 


All rails i checked are giving correct value. S3 and S0 rails give correct value at the moment fan tries to spin ( spin quarter and stop). Also all sys good giving 3.3 at the moment of fan spins. 


No water damage just someone didnt screwed it well and there was a screw going up to down over logic board that must make short something somewhere. 


Any idea?

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message: Solved. R1270 was fucked.

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message: CHanged now boot and on half logo progress bar it stays darked with backlight lcd ON. Also tried from USB, internet recovery mode etc and same, when it arrived about 50% of progress bar computer hungs with lcd's backlight on. Seems be hardware. What can i do:D?

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message:
First of all, disconnect internal SSD and test it witk known good OSX through USB.
Also try clean ME BIOS.

Do you mean new efi chip? I must have some in my chips for this model.

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message:
Are you sure about clean ME?
Where did you get the dump?
I hope not vinafix...

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message: i had extraced EFI chip from working macbook air and soldered it on broken one. Not booting. After returned it to donor board and board booting fine.

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message: macbook air donor was the same board.

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message:
Yeah same board, DIFFERENT PCH.
I was expected you was already aware of what this means...

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message: How you know that PCH are differents?

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message:
Did you resolder the same PCH???
I don't think.
Any piece is DIFFERENT.
I don talk about model number!
Any chip has its differencies due to manufacture process.
ME region correct these differencies.
When boots, if PCH detects clean ME region, will configure data area.
If ME region is already configured (by other PCH), data area is not changed; even if it doesn't correspond to actual PCH.

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message: THank you  for that info. WIll buy medusa to reconfigure it. Will back next week with result.

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message:
We already have posted links for BIOS with clean ME region for your board.
You will need to replace serial number at the end, but use downloaded file as is, just for test.

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message:

Finally i tried CLearme and DUMP EFI and the result is same. Computer boots begin to load and after that no image only backlight. The only way i got into installations was with CMD+R but after download all and restart to install same thing happened. 


Any idea what else it can be?

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.

Or just tried a dump from Internet?

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.

clean me with medusa, and dump from internet. Tried both options

Anyway is it possible that PCH can fail like this?

title: 820-3437 try to spin. All rails are ok.
message:
Yeah, could be.
Check if ASD EFI reports something about Management Engine.

Also try the machine with Linux and Windows.
You may sell it as reversed HackIntosh...
